groups.title: Customer Due Diligence — Trusts
groups.description: This section covers the complete customer identification and due diligence process for customers acting as trustees of trusts, including collection, verification, and risk-based assessment of trust information.

groups.title: 1. Scope and General Obligations
groups.description: Initial determination of whether the trust customer is within scope and establishment of general obligations to verify trust existence and key parties.

groups.title: 2. Collection of Trust KYC Information
groups.description: Procedures for collecting minimum and additional KYC information about the trust, including trust details, trustee information, settlor details, and beneficiary information.

groups.title: 3. Verification of Trust Information
groups.description: Procedures for verifying collected trust information, including minimum verification requirements, simplified procedures for eligible trusts, and acceptable verification methods.

groups.title: 4. Risk-Based Assessment and Additional Due Diligence
groups.description: Risk-based systems and controls for determining additional collection and verification requirements based on ML/TF risk relevant to the designated service.

groups.title: 5. Verification Methods and Sources
groups.description: Acceptable methods and sources for verifying trust information, including trust deeds, independent documents, electronic data, and disclosure certificates.

groups.title: 6. Discrepancy Handling and Resolution
groups.description: Systems and controls for responding to and resolving discrepancies that arise during the verification process.

groups.title: 7. Exemptions and Modified Requirements
groups.description: Simplified or exempted requirements for specific trust types including regulated trusts, managed investment schemes, government superannuation funds, custodians, and nominees.
